Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Municipal \Mu*nic"i*pal\, a. [L. municipalis, fr. municipium a town, particularly in Italy, which possessed the right of Roman citizenship, but was governed by its own laws, a free town, fr. municeps an inhabitant of a free town, a free citizen; munia official duties, functions + capere to take: cf. F. municipal. Cf. {Immunity}, and {Capacoius}.] 1. Of or pertaining to a city or a corporation having the right of administering local government; as, municipal rights; municipal officers. [1913 Webster]
2. Of or pertaining to a state, kingdom, or nation. [1913 Webster]
Municipal law is properly defined to be a rule of civil conduct prescribed by the supreme power in a state. --Blackstone. [1913 Webster]

municipal adj 1: relating or belonging to or characteristic of a municipality; "municipal government"; "municipal bonds"; "a municipal park"; "municipal transportation" 2: of or relating to the government of a municipality; "international law...only authorizes a belligerant to punish a spy under its municipal law"- J.L.kuntz
